title: [$500] Web - Profile - When selecting the last country or state extra space is displayed for a while

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

comments.body: Triggered auto assignment to @sonialiap (`Bug`), see https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/14418 for more details.
Job added to Upwork: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~01e93d2572ea063da0

### Bug0 Triage Checklist ([Main S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418))

- [ ] This "bug" occurs on a supported platform (ensure `Platforms` in OP are ✅)
- [ ] This bug is not a duplicate report (check [E/App issues](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues) and [#expensify-bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM))
    - If it is, comment with a link to the original report, close the issue and add any novel details to the original issue instead
- [ ] This bug is reproducible using the reproduction steps in the OP. [S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418#:~:text=The%20bug%20is%20reproducible)
    - If the reproduction steps are clear and you're unable to reproduce the bug, check with the reporter and QA first, then close the issue.
    - If the reproduction steps aren't clear and you determine the correct steps, please update the OP.
- [ ] This issue is filled out as thoroughly and clearly as possible
    - Pay special attention to the title, results, platforms where the bug occurs, and if the bug happens on staging/production.
- [ ] I have reviewed and subscribed to the linked Slack conversation to ensure Slack/Github stay in sync
Triggered auto assignment to Contributor-plus team member for initial proposal review - @burczu (`External`)
@lanitochka17 the space looks uniform to me, am I missing something?

On macbook(Chrome) I have a bit different situation but looks similar 

https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/68128028/a059a87a-7024-415b-a104-926caf056d3a


# Proposal
## Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue.

Web - Profile - When selecting the last country or state extra space is displayed for a while

## What is the root cause of that problem?

The main problem is how many elements we display when rendering the SectionList per batch

https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/da549c0a45edb23fbe9616a9ce21915f291eabe4/src/components/SelectionList/BaseSelectionList.js#L454

https://reactnative.dev/docs/optimizing-flatlist-configuration#maxtorenderperbatch

And since we select the last element
The list needs time to display the last elements
This is why we see bugs like this.

## What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem?

To fix this bug we can increase this property from `5` to `15`(for example) to Increase the list display speed
Also, we have `initialNumToRender` and `windowSize`. We can also use these properties for optimization.

https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/da549c0a45edb23fbe9616a9ce21915f291eabe4/src/components/SelectionList/BaseSelectionList.js#L453-L455

As an alternative, we can pass these values like props from `CountrySelectionPage`, `StateSelectorModal`, and other screens 

## What alternative solutions did you explore? (Optional)

We can also make separate configs for different numbers of elements
And if the lists have more than 100 elements for example
We will increase the values (`initialNumToRender`, `windowSize`, `maxToRenderPerBatch`) to display elements better
Because the current values we use for long lists are not very suitable 

Or at least we can use dynamic values that we will calculate depending on the number of visible elements using `onLayout` from SectionList. But I'm not sure this approach will work for all lists. so if we decide to use dynamic `maxToRenderPerBatch`, then it is better to create a new prop that will enable and disable dynamic `maxToRenderPerBatch`

We can update `scrollToFocusedIndexOnFirstRender` like 

```
   const [maxToRenderPerBatch, setMaxToRenderPerBatch] = useState(5);
   
    const scrollToFocusedIndexOnFirstRender = useCallback(
        (layout) => {
            if(isDynamicMaxToRenderPerBatch) {
              // I added 5(or we can multiply by 2) because the scrolling speed is higher than updating elements as tall as a list. 
 But this is more of an additional functionality
             setMaxToRenderPerBatch((layout.nativeEvent.layout.height / layout.nativeEvent.layout.y) + 5); (optional Math.ceil())
            }
            if (!firstLayoutRef.current) {
                return;
            }
            scrollToIndex(focusedIndex, false);
            firstLayoutRef.current = false;
        },
        [focusedIndex, scrollToIndex],
    );
```

https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/6c29cabf1cce381bc927af52f819223ba6b541bc/src/components/SelectionList/BaseSelectionList.js#L313-L319

And then update this line like:

`maxToRenderPerBatch={maxToRenderPerBatch}`

https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/6c29cabf1cce381bc927af52f819223ba6b541bc/src/components/SelectionList/BaseSelectionList.js#L454

And since we only need this functionality for a certain number of screens
We can use `isDynamicMaxToRenderPerBatch`

We can add this prop here 

https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/6c29cabf1cce381bc927af52f819223ba6b541bc/src/components/StatePicker/StateSelectorModal.js#L95-L104

And here

https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/6c29cabf1cce381bc927af52f819223ba6b541bc/src/pages/settings/Profile/PersonalDetails/CountrySelectionPage.js#L91-L99

## Proposal Change the `maxToRenderPerBatch` value dependent on the window height. ### Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue. The number of initially rendered selection of countries is not enough to fill the screen. ### What is the root cause of that problem? According to the code below, the specified number of selections to be rendered initially is `12` but for some reason is not visually being applied. https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/da549c0a45edb23fbe9616a9ce21915f291eabe4/src/components/SelectionList/BaseSelectionList.js#L453-L454 It seems that the number of components being visually rendered is determined by `maxToRenderPerBatch`. ### What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem? To avoid hardcoding a bigger value to make sure the selection is initially filled, we can simply replace the value `5` with: ```Math.ceil((window.innerHeight - 129)/ 64)```. Essentially this formula will calculate how much countries can be shown in the screen. Why do we subtract `window.innerHeight` with `129`? - 129 is the pixel height of the `Country` Header component plus the height of the Search input for countries. Why do we divide by `64`? - `64` is the height of a selectable country component We then Math.ceil it since we want a whole number since if the quotient is a decimal, it would be impossible to render a component at a fraction. We use Math.ceil instead of Math.floor because in cases wherein the quotients decimal is near the value `1` (0.9, 0.8, etc), a space may still show if we decide to floor it. The value we get from the formula ```Math.ceil((window.innerHeight - 129)/ 64)``` will give us the number of Country components that can fill the initial space. ### What alternative solutions did you explore? (Optional) - N/A

***Proposal : Fix for this Issue***

**Source of the Problem**
The Initial Number of items being rendered for the list is small , not enough to fill the screen , causing this glitch while opening the country or state selection modal.


What is the root cause of that problem?
 the specified number of selections to be rendered initially is 12 which is small and not enough to fill the screen on every device size causing a glitch effect. 

```
 initialNumToRender={12} 
 maxToRenderPerBatch={5} 
```
It seems that the number of components being visually rendered is determined by maxToRenderPerBatch.

**Fix for the problem**
A bigger value can be passed to the section list.A number large enough to fill the screen that will stop this glitch from occuring that shows up for a while. 
We can also avoid just passing a large number statically and pass a more dynamic number that would be optimal for all screen sizes the general formula used would be  windowHeight/(height of countryItem)
.This will give us the exact number of items initally required to be rendered on the screen.

📣 @aum1618! 📣
Hey, it seems we don’t have your contributor details yet! You'll only have to do this once, and this is how we'll hire you on Upwork.

2. Get the email address used to login to your Expensify account. If you don't already have an Expensify account, create one [here](https://new.expensify.com/). If you have multiple accounts (e.g. one for testing), please use your main account email.
3. Get the link to your Upwork profile. It's necessary because we only pay via Upwork. You can access it by logging in, and then clicking on your name. It'll look like [this](https://www.upwork.com/freelancers/~01ca8ad8ce36b9eceb). If you don't already have an account, sign up for one [here](https://www.upwork.com/nx/signup/?dest=home).
4. Copy the format below and paste it in a comment on this issue. Replace the placeholder text with your actual details.


@Fralalala I like your solution the most (calculating the `maxToRenderPerBatch` value based on the screen height is IMO a good idea), but the idea to change the `BaseSelectionList` the way you propose is not good - this component is used by the `SelectionList` component, which is used in many places in the app, so this calculation should not be done there. Please update your proposal to address only the issue with the country selector in the personal details page.

> @Fralalala I like your solution the most (calculating the `maxToRenderPerBatch` value based on the screen height is IMO a good idea), but the idea to change the `BaseSelectionList` the way you propose is not good - this component is used by the `SelectionList` component, which is used in many places in the app, so this calculation should not be done there. Please update your proposal to address only the issue with the country selector in the personal details page.


Maybe Instead of getting the screen height, we should use the height of the list itself using onLayout ?
@Fralalala Yeah, it is also worth checking what @ZhenjaHorbach pointed.

> @Fralalala Yeah, it is also worth checking what @ZhenjaHorbach pointed.

This idea is in my proposal))
Plus in onLayout we have access to item height

Alright, @ZhenjaHorbach you are right, but you wasn't very specific how to do it exactly and it was just some alternative solution. Please update your proposal too - putting everything together, we need here: 

1. to calculate the `maxRenderPerBatch` dynamically
2. to update the country selector, not the `BaseSelectionList` component (or maybe analyse all other usages of the `SelectionList` component and decide if we can do it consistent? If know the height of the list item in the `onLayout` handler it should be possible then, maybe?)

Ok, thanks @ZhenjaHorbach for the update.

That being said, I think we should pick [the optional proposal](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/31660#issuecomment-1821733945) from @ZhenjaHorbach where they utilize the `onLayout` handler (`scrollToFocusedIndexOnFirstRender`) to calculate the `maxRenderPerBatch` value.

Sorry @Fralalala, I know you've also suggested the dynamic calculation of the `maxRenderPerBatch` property but I think the solution from @ZhenjaHorbach is just more comprehensive.

🎀 👀 🎀 C+ reviewed
Triggered auto assignment to @mountiny, see https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/7972 for more details.

> @Fralalala I like your solution the most (calculating the `maxToRenderPerBatch` value based on the screen height is IMO a good idea), but the idea to change the `BaseSelectionList` the way you propose is not good - this component is used by the `SelectionList` component, which is used in many places in the app, so this calculation should not be done there. Please update your proposal to address only the issue with the country selector in the personal details page.

To solve this we can specify the num items inside the countryList and the State List  (Where we are seeing this issue) by calculating the number of items using onLayout and pass this as a prop to the SectionList .Then in the sectionList we can destructure this prop and give it an arbitrary value of 12  (the value already given to the list ) this way if no prop is passed it will behave as expected and the change will only apply to where we are seeing this issue. Something kind of like this
`
const SectionList =({maxToRenderPerBatch=12})=>{
`
Now if we pass the value from the CountryLsit the change will only be applied there

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 1.4.1-7 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team **Slack conversation:** ## Action Performed: 1. Go to Settings > Profile > Personal details > Address. 2. Click on the country and select "Zimbabwe." 3. Click on the country again and notice space below. 4. Now, select "United States" and choose the last state. 5. Click on the state again and notice extra space for a while ## Expected Result: When selecting the last country or state, extra space should not be displayed below the country list or state ## Actual Result: When selecting the last country or state, extra space is displayed for a while below the list ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Which of our officially supported platforms is this issue occurring on? - [ ] Android: Native - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: Native - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos Add any screenshot/video evidence https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/78819774/4b3dd7cb-52d3-4859-9acc-ae487dff33f9 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
